availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hartson E. Fillmore (Hamilton County, Ohio, soldier and deputy court clerk.)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, soldier and deputy court clerk. Cincinnati, Ohio, native. Son of Ebenezer H. Fillmore and Mary H. Smith Fillmore. Attended school in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1850. Attended school in Cincinnati in 1860. Served in the 6th Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from April 20, 1861, to August 21, 1861. Served in the 137th Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from May 2, 1864, to August 19, 1864. Deputy clerk of the Hamilton County Court of Common Pleas in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 3, p. 195B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 3, p. 162.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866, vol. I (Akron, OH: The Werner Company, 1893), 110.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866, vol. VIII (Cincinnati, OH: The Ohio Valley Press, 1888), 657.
Reuben H. Walworth, Hyde Genealogy; or the Descendants, in the Female as Well as in the Male Lines, from William Hyde, of Norwich, with Their Places of Residence, and Dates of Births, Marriages, &c., and Other Particulars of Them and Their Families and Ancestry (Albany, NY: J. Munsell, 1864), 727.
